page.title: 07AGRICULTURE
page.content: There are nine separate farms in the Rookhope area, from Redburn Farm on the north side of Rookhope to North Hanging Wells on the south side of the village. As this area is at least twelve hundred feet above sea level all the farms are known as Hill Farms-mainly comprising of suckler beef and Swaledale sheep, although one farm also keeps a dairy herd. Milk from this is both sold locally and collected by the Milk Marketing Board. Most of the farmers manage to make a living from their land alone, although one or two have other paid employment.
